content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

I would choose B{}.

Here's my reasoning: In this game, choosing the same option (R or B) as the anonymous player in every round results in a lower payoff compared to when the choices are different. However, the difference is not significant enough to justify taking a risky strategy for the entire 75 rounds. Choosing R would potentially earn me more money if my partner always chooses B, but it also leaves me with nothing if they happen to choose R even once in those 75 rounds.

On the other hand, choosing B ensures that I have a guaranteed minimum payoff of 40$ per round, except for the rounds where my partner picks R and I pick B as well (which would result in a 35$ payout). Since the payoff is still reasonable even when my partner chooses R, I can tolerate some risk of this happening occasionally.

Additionally, considering that this is an anonymous player and there are 75 rounds, it's unlikely that we will be able to predict or influence each other's choices over time. Therefore, choosing B seems like a more prudent and secure strategy for me as a moderately cautious individual who values security and predictability.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

I would choose R{}.

However, since we both chose B in the first round and received the same payout, it's possible that my opponent might consider switching strategies in the next round.

Choosing R now could potentially benefit me if my opponent switches to choosing R as well, resulting in a higher payout of 45$ for both of us. It also allows me to explore the possibility of earning more money throughout the game if my opponent sticks with their new strategy of choosing R or adjusts it later on.

On the other hand, if my opponent continues with the strategy of choosing B, I will still receive a payout of 40$, which is not significantly lower than what I received in the first round. Therefore, taking this slight risk by choosing R seems justifiable as it provides an opportunity to potentially earn more money over time.
